metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11324 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
The urllib3 library before 1.24.2 for Python mishandles certain cases wherethe desired set of CA certificates is different from the OS store of CAcertificates, which results in SSL connections succeeding in situationswhere a verification failure is the correct outcome. This is related to useof the ssl_context, ca_certs, or ca_certs_dir argument.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11324` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-urllib3 - 1.22-1ubuntu0.18.04.1
python3-urllib3 - 1.22-1ubuntu0.18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: python-urllib3 package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.22-1ubuntu0.18.04.1').
